org.springframework.integration.dsl

Class SplitterEndpointSpec<S extends org.springframework.integration.splitter.AbstractMessageSplitter>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.integration.dsl.core.IntegrationComponentSpec<S,Tuple2<F,H>>

        • org.springframework.integration.dsl.core.ConsumerEndpointSpec<SplitterEndpointSpec<S>,S>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - the target SplitterEndpointSpec implementation type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:

    public final class SplitterEndpointSpec<S extends org.springframework.integration.splitter.AbstractMessageSplitter>
extends ConsumerEndpointSpec<SplitterEndpointSpec<S>,S>
    A ConsumerEndpointSpec for a AbstractMessageSplitter implementations.
    Author:
    Artem Bilan

    • Method Detail

      • applySequence

        public SplitterEndpointSpec<S> applySequence(boolean applySequence)
        Set the applySequence flag to the specified value. Defaults to true.
        Parameters:
        applySequence - the applySequence.
        Returns:
        the endpoint spec.
        See Also:
        AbstractMessageSplitter.setApplySequence(boolean)

      • delimiters

        public SplitterEndpointSpec<S> delimiters(java.lang.String delimiters)
        Set delimiters to tokenize String values. The default is null indicating that no tokenizing should occur. If delimiters are provided, they will be applied to any String payload. Only applied if provided splitter is instance of DefaultMessageSplitter.
        Parameters:
        delimiters - The delimiters.
        Returns:
        the endpoint spec.
        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        DefaultMessageSplitter.setDelimiters(String)
